subjectCategories: Space Communications, Spacecraft Communications, Command and Tracking
title: Reconfigurable Protocol Sensing in an End-to-End Demonstration

organization.name: Jet Propulsion Lab., California Inst. of Tech.
Jet Propulsion Lab., California Inst. of Tech.
Jet Propulsion Lab., California Inst. of Tech.

abstract: In this work, we present sensing performance using an architecture for a reconfigurable protocol chip for spacebased applications. Toward utilizing the IP packet architecture, utilizing data link layer framing structures for multiplexed data on a channel are the targeted application considered for demonstration purposes. Specifically, we examine three common framing standards and present the sensing performance of these standards and their relative de-correlation metrics. Some analysis is performed to investigate the impact of lossy links. Finally, we present results on a demonstration platform that integrated reconfigurable sensing technology into the Ground Station Interface Device (GRID) for End-to-End IP demonstrations in space.

meetings.name: Earth Science Technology Conference, College Park, Maryland, June 27-29, 2006
